actor_awards.notes: Known for his stage career and his acerbic, sophisticated screen persona. He received Academy Award nominations for 'Laura', 'The Razor's Edge', and 'Sitting Pretty'. He won a Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Razor's Edge'.

filmography.title: Laura
filmography.role_description: An effete, acerbic newspaper columnist who becomes a suspect in the murder of his protégé.
filmography.plot: A police detective falls in love with the woman whose murder he is investigating.

filmography.title: The Razor's Edge
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, snobbish American expatriate in Paris who values social standing above all else.
filmography.plot: A disillusioned WWI veteran travels the world seeking spiritual enlightenment, while his friends and former fiancée pursue wealth and status.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Sitting Pretty
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, arrogant self-proclaimed genius who takes a job as a live-in babysitter for a suburban family.
filmography.plot: A family hires a man as a babysitter, only to find that he is a genius who proceeds to take over the household and write a tell-all book.

filmography.title: Cheaper by the Dozen
filmography.role_description: The efficiency expert father who runs his large family of twelve children with strict precision.
filmography.plot: The story of efficiency expert Frank Gilbreth and his wife Lillian as they raise twelve children in the 1920s.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Color Cinematography

filmography.title: Titanic
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, estranged husband attempting to take his children back to America on the ill-fated liner.
filmography.plot: An unhappily married couple struggle to deal with their problems while on board the ill-fated ship.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Writing, Story and Screenplay

filmography.title: The Dark Corner
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated but ruthless art dealer who frames a private eye for murder.
filmography.plot: A private detective is framed for murder and must find the real killer to clear his name, leading him to a wealthy art gallery owner.

filmography.title: Three Coins in the Fountain
filmography.role_description: An expatriate writer in Rome who falls for his long-time secretary.
filmography.plot: Three American women working in Rome share a spacious apartment and the desire to find romance.

filmography.title: The Man Who Never Was
filmography.role_description: A naval intelligence officer who orchestrates a brilliant deception operation during World War II.
filmography.plot: British intelligence tries to trick the Axis powers into thinking the Allied invasion of Sicily will actually take place in Greece.

filmography.title: Stars and Stripes Forever
filmography.role_description: The famous American composer and conductor known for his military marches.
filmography.plot: A biography of composer and bandleader John Philip Sousa.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Mr. Belvedere Goes to College
filmography.role_description: The genius eccentric returns, this time enrolling in college to fulfill a requirement for an award.
filmography.plot: Lynn Belvedere enrolls in a university, where he encounters hazing, romance, and skeptical professors.

filmography.title: Dreamboat
filmography.role_description: A respected college professor whose past as a silent film matinee idol is exposed on television.
filmography.plot: A college professor's quiet life is disrupted when his old silent movies are shown on TV, leading to a revival of interest in his former career.

filmography.title: Boy on a Dolphin
filmography.role_description: A wealthy and unscrupulous art collector trying to illegally obtain an ancient Greek treasure.
filmography.plot: A sponge diver discovers a sunken ship with a valuable statue and becomes caught between an archaeologist and a wealthy collector.

filmography.title: Woman's World
filmography.role_description: The owner of a major automobile company who invites three employees and their wives to New York to choose a new general manager.
filmography.plot: Three ambitious executives compete for a top job, but their wives are also being judged by the company owner.

filmography.title: Mr. Belvedere Rings the Bell
filmography.role_description: Mr. Belvedere brings his unique talents to a home for the aged to prove that one is only as old as one feels.
filmography.plot: Lynn Belvedere enters an old folks' home to prove his theory about aging and revitalizes the residents.

filmography.title: Elopement
filmography.role_description: A father who chases after his daughter who has eloped with a college professor.
filmography.plot: Two families chase after their eloping children in a frantic cross-country pursuit.

filmography.title: For Heaven's Sake
filmography.role_description: An angel sent to earth to save the marriage of a theatre couple.
filmography.plot: Two angels come to Earth to help a couple who are too busy with their careers to start a family.

filmography.title: Mr. Scoutmaster
filmography.role_description: A cynical TV personality who becomes a scoutmaster to better understand the youth audience.
filmography.plot: A television host hoping to appeal to a younger demographic takes charge of a chaotic Boy Scout troop.

filmography.title: The Remarkable Mr. Pennypacker
filmography.role_description: A businessman in the 1890s who secretly maintains two separate families in two different cities.
filmography.plot: A turn-of-the-century businessman successfully juggles two families in different cities until his children start to meet.

filmography.title: Holiday for Lovers
filmography.role_description: An overprotective father who takes his family on a vacation to South America to check up on his daughter.
filmography.plot: A father takes his family on a trip to Brazil to spy on his eldest daughter's romance.

filmography.title: Satan Never Sleeps
filmography.role_description: An elderly priest in China who faces the Communist revolution alongside a younger priest.
filmography.plot: Two Catholic priests in China face persecution and hardship during the Communist takeover in 1949.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: Polly with a Past
filmography.role_description: Webb's film debut in a silent comedy based on a stage play.
filmography.plot: A minister's daughter poses as a French adventuress to help a young man make the girl he loves jealous.
